job_title: Emergency Room Nurse in Nashua, NH
pros: Amazing staff to work with, the people make it worth it. Offer tuition reimbursement and 15-30 dollar bonus offered for overtime shifts.
cons: No mandated patient ratios. Have had up to 6 patients at a time. Poor patient flow, patients get held in the ER for long periods of time.

review_title: They don't take care of their "heroes"
pros: I'm not sure there are any anymore
cons: Working here through the pandemic has been terrible. Employees get treated poorly by both management and patients now. We used to get yearly bonuses and now they give frozen turkeys. What a slap in the face!

job_title: Lead Patient Support Representative in Nashua, NH
pros: If you are looking for chances to advance this is the company to work for.
cons: When we are short staffed, it makes it really hard on a day-to-day basis.

review_title: Not what it used to be...
pros: Excellent earned time policy for time off. Eight hours of earned time accrued for every two week pay period.
cons:
Ever since the merger with Elliot hospital, upper management has been in a downward spiral.
Raises are are almost completely negated by inflation and increases in the cost of living.

pros: close to home, good company to work for

pros: Good people to work with

pros: Good work environment, they are flexible with ET time requests. employees treatment is fair. It has a decent health care premiums.

job_title: Call Center Representative in Nashua, NH
pros: Flexible hours, Great coworkers, Supportive team

job_title: Patient Service Representative Through Foundation Medical Partners in Nashua, NH
pros: The office I worked at was very flexible, offered OT and the doctors were all very friendly. The company as a whole offers great benefits and occasionally offers a bonus if they do better than their anticipated yearly revenue.
cons: Every office is different, so it is hard to say what you will get. Some offices have less than friendly staff, including doctors. Some managers are more strict, and less flexible than others.

pros: Equal opportunity employer and provides higher level of care
cons: Does not pay well and employee retention is poor

review_title: Overall the hospital is a good place to work.
pros: The benefits are pretty good. There is also opportunity to transfer if you need a change.
cons: Working a lot of holidays.

pros: Food is good there and cheap
cons: Pay could be higher for the hard work being done

pros: Fair amount of support. Fair work environment and culture.
cons: Absolutely need to hire more staff. Continuously requesting and expecting OT. Needs better management, clearer policies, better educational competencies and collaboration amount interdisciplinary team.

pros: Friendly people, good work, lovely manager

pros: Great personalities all around, departments work well together.
cons: Management rarely promotes from within. Many opportunities for advancement will play favorite to friend employees. Low pay compared to surrounding hospitals. $4 less an hour on average.

pros: daytime hours, work from home
cons: low pay, little PTO, hectic

pros: Great pay, great people, great hours!
cons: Sometimes you have to touch food that came straight from a sick patients room, but with the protective gear they provide you its like the cleanest and best paying dishwashing job imaginable.

pros: great group of people to work with
cons: could have had a higher pay rate

pros: Great company to work for
cons: No cons in my experience

pros: Caring dedicated staff. Work with competent nurses who work along side you
cons: Lack of acknowledgement from HR and management as Clinical assistants as professionals

pros: Free employee parking. 24 hour security that actually does rounding and cares about staff and safety. There is only one unlocked entrance overnight supervised by security and visitors are required to sign in. Security is available to escort staff to their vehicles after hours. The hospital floats nursing and LNAs to supplement staffing the vast majority of the time. The cafeteria is open on every shift except weekend nights.
cons: The med-surge floors are specialized units so you will tend to work with certain patient populations which does not allow for new nurses to become well rounded in their experience. The training period for new nurses is about a month and many do not feel adequately trained or prepared once off orientation. Staffing ratios are not always ideal. The environment of management and administration is very political so if you are not well liked by someone who is well liked, you will probably suffer and your concerns will not be addressed.

review_title: There may be good opportunities at this institution, but proceed with caution.
pros: Small community hospital just over the border of new hampshire in close proximity to Boston.  Friendy people and divesrse population of people to work with.  Majority of doctors are very good at what they do and dedicated.  Good benefits and potential for growth depending on what your field of expertise is.
cons: Currently ; its outpatient services are growing so fast, that the growth outpaces the organizations efforts to prioritize what it needs to focus on first and money is not always well spent.  As a result, employees wages and cost of living raises have suffered in recent years.  Salary adjustments are lagging behind.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant in Nashua, NH
pros: The people that I worked closest with on a daily basis,  and the patients were the best part of working there.
cons: Management has got to be the most unfair that I have ever worked under. Staff meetings are done in a way where minutes are handed out precopied, and no one is really allowed to voice an opinion or speak except for provider's and the manager. IF there are problems,  the providers are constantly on the phone messaging the manager about it instead of coming to the MA's and just addressing the little problems,  that now cause the MA's to get brought into the managers office and reprimanded for silly things that never should have gone to that level. I have never worked in such a hostile environment,  where I felt my job was constantly on the line.

pros: SNHMC has some wonderful employees that are very focused on quality patient care. Some of the physicians employed by the Center are among the best I have ever known.  There is a company paid pension if you have enough longevity.
cons: Upper management has supported incompetent middle managers for decades.  Some managers are seriously disorganized, violate hospital policies, engaged in social relationships with supervisees and play favorites.  Communication is poor.  Training is minimal.  There are significant inequities in salaries among people doing the same jobs, despite being more experienced and qualified.

review_title: Not a very good place to go work
pros: Nice people to work with. Cafeteria food prices are low, and food is not that bad, you can deduct the food out of your paycheck.
cons: Low pay, not good health benefits, little time off.  No work from home.  Little organizational standards, they just "wing" things and it made me very nervous (administrative level).  People are placed in positions that they should not be in, no experience.  No performance raise; you do not have to do anything to get a raise. Personal growth opportunities do not exist.  "Perception is everything".  Departments have a hard time seeing the big picture.

review_title: Want to be a cog in a machine? Work here.
pros: Salary and benefits acceptable, except horrible health insurance.
cons: Many in management and administration are dishonest and unethical. If you try to communicate to them, they do not listen and do not want to hear what you have to say. If you try to speak out on concerning issues you will suffer consequences as their only aim is to sustain the status quo, even if there is dysfunction or hostile management tactics. Upper management keeps middle managers in place, even though they are inept to say the least.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Nashua, NH
pros: A great place to work!  Patient centered while maintaining compassion and respect for healthcare team.   Practices servant leadership evidenced across the organization.  A growing health system yet still able to feel you know and collaborate with, make friends with people in all areas of the organization.   Career growth opportunities in all areas.   Easy commute from most places, parking on-site.  Excellent benefits.  Major holidays and weekends off in many areas.
cons: No on-site gym facility for admin. and non-provider clinical staff.

review_title: go work somewhere else if you want to be recognized by your good work and dedication.....
pros: depending on the  manager or supervisor it might be ok to  take vacations or sick days. Or you might have to "schedule your sick days!!!!!"
cons: lower pay than other area hospitals based on experience. They rather hire from outside than promote within!! even if the employee is dedicated and deserving!!

review_title: Not what I expected, not as described
pros: Helped motivate me and made me clearly understand what kind of management team I did NOT want to work for.
cons: During interview and first few months, I was excited about working at SNHHS.  As time went by it was very clear the right hand hand no idea what the left hand was doing.  In addition, (my) department leaders proved to be untrustworthy.  Rules are not consistent, not within departments nor within the HS itself.

pros: Compensation was good and there was no problem getting time off.
cons: Over privileged cardiologists who are legends in their own mind. Spoiled sonographers who put their own needs above patient care. Very cliquey lab to work in. Very little ideological diversity.

pros: Benefits are okay. Time off is standard. Leadership is extremely poor.
cons: Very little time to train, due to under staffing. Training never completed to best of ability.

review_title: good to pay off my bills.
pros: Not a good fit if you have a creative mind and need a little more freedom in your job.  They tend to be really rigid with the rules.
cons: really great pay and benefits and the job itself was not too hard.

pros: It is a good company to work for. Employees are genuinely happy and the company seems to support the employees well
cons: Pay is not comparable to other facilities. The deductibles for healthcare are a bit high but maybe not more than other companies.

review_title: Never Had a good experience there
pros: The staff was so nice, I can admit that. But that is the only nice thing I can say about this hospital.
cons: The people just were not organized causing patients stress.  They would lose things and leave out important information on discharge papers.

pros: Nobody is wrong as nobody knows what the right thing to do is.
cons: Patients and doctors/staff are all unhappy. Management and nurses/doctors lives on different planet. Management team is bottom of the rung. Poor work culture and wouldn't ask any patient to come here. Never work here.

pros: This local company provides good benefits.
cons: The management of this company is not top notch.

pros: This company is working hard to improve
cons: Holidays come out of earned time

pros: Great work life balance, and friendly staff.
cons: Enjoyed working with the company.
